title: ExamEngine – FastAPI Exam Platform
summary: FastAPI exam system for single/multiple-answer tests with clean REST APIs, minimal HTML UI, scoring breakdowns, and OpenAPI docs. Prod on Cloud Run behind HTTPS LB with Cloud SQL (Postgres).

title: Analysis on Climate Change and Impact of Greenhouse Gas Emission
summary: Predictive modeling and analysis of climate change patterns driven by greenhouse gas emissions. Built ETL pipelines using GCP services (BigQuery, DataStream, Cloud Composer) and visualized insights with Tableau. Includes real-time + archived data pipelines and ML models (ARIMA, regression) for forecasting.

title: ComicGen – AI Comic Strip Generator
summary: Multimodal AI-powered tool for generating comic strips using GPT-4, LoRA, BERT, and Stable Diffusion. Improved quality consistency by ~30% and automated creative workflows.

title: Rain-drops Simulation
summary: Python game built with Pygame + Pymunk: catch raindrops with realistic gravity/bounce, rain-sound background, slider to adjust rain speed, splash effects, and interactive controls.

title: Commercial Building Energy Optimization – A Machine Learning Approach
summary: Predict HVAC load from 300+ sensors over 3 years to cut energy waste; time-series feature engineering and ML models to improve forecast reliability and operational efficiency.

title: Music Recommendation System
summary: Content-based recommendations using genre/year/beat features with KNN, Decision Tree, Random Forest, Logistic Regression, and TF-IDF; focuses on accuracy, diversity, and user input.

title: LinkedIn Job Post Analysis
summary: Analyzed LinkedIn job postings using two approaches: (1) MongoDB pipeline for data ingestion & query, and (2) Relational Database schema with SQL-based design, queries, and MySQL integration. Explored trends in companies, skills, and job requirements.

title: Deep Learning Projects Collection
summary: A collection of deep learning notebooks covering PyTorch, TensorFlow, CNNs, GANs, LSTMs, Transformers, LangChain, StyleGAN, RAGs, Toxic Comment Classification, and more.

title: SF Fire Alarm Analysis
summary: Predicted and analyzed fire incidents in San Francisco using 678K+ records from the Fire Department. Feature engineering, predictive modeling, and data-driven insights to improve resource allocation and public safety.
